meanings.definition: Lacking: not having something that is needed or expected
meanings.sent1: The poor squirrel was laking food for the winter.
meanings.sent2: She felt laking in confidence before the big presentation.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful wizard was laking his wand when he needed to cast a spell.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt laking in warmth after the argument with her best friend.
meanings.sent5: The old house was laking in charm compared to the new one down the street.

meanings.definition: Lacking: deficient in a specified way
meanings.sent1: The worn-out shoes were laking proper support for his feet.
meanings.sent2: The team was laking experience in handling such a complex project.
meanings.sent3: The cake was delicious but laking in sweetness.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was laking in detail, leaving many questions unanswered.
meanings.sent5: The painting was beautiful but laking in vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: The laking sunlight made the room feel cold and dreary.
meanings.sent2: The laking ingredients forced her to change the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The laking bus caused them to be late for the movie.
meanings.sent4: His laking presence at the party was noticed by many.
meanings.sent5: The laking stars in the sky made the night seem unusually dark.
